slides.title: Welcome to Electrical Engineering
slides.content:
# Introduction to Electrical Engineering

Welcome to **Electrical Engineering** - powering the world!

## What You Will Learn:
- **Circuit Theory** - Basic components and laws
- **AC/DC Analysis** - Different current types
- **Electronics** - Semiconductors and digital
- **Power Systems** - Generation and distribution
- **Signals** - Processing information

> **Fun Fact:** The electrical grid is often called the largest machine ever built!

slides.title: Basic Quantities
slides.content:
# Basic Electrical Quantities

## Fundamental Units:

| Quantity | Symbol | Unit | Definition |
|----------|--------|------|------------|
| Charge | Q | Coulombs (C) | 1 C = 6.24 x 10^18 electrons |
| Current | I | Amperes (A) | Charge flow rate |
| Voltage | V | Volts (V) | Energy per charge |
| Resistance | R | Ohms | Opposition to current |
| Power | P | Watts (W) | Energy rate |

## Ohm's Law:
```
V = I x R
```

## Power:
```
P = V x I = I^2 x R = V^2 / R
```

slides.title: Circuit Components
slides.content:
# Circuit Components

## Passive Components:

| Component | Symbol | Function |
|-----------|--------|----------|
| Resistor | R | Limits current |
| Capacitor | C | Stores charge |
| Inductor | L | Stores magnetic energy |

## Active Components:
- Diodes
- Transistors
- Operational amplifiers
- Integrated circuits

## Component Equations:
```
Resistor: V = IR
Capacitor: i = C(dv/dt)
Inductor: v = L(di/dt)
```

slides.title: Series and Parallel
slides.content:
# Series and Parallel Circuits

## Resistors:

| Configuration | Resistance | Current | Voltage |
|---------------|------------|---------|--------|
| Series | R_total = R1 + R2 + R3 | Same | Divides |
| Parallel | 1/R_total = 1/R1 + 1/R2 | Divides | Same |

## Capacitors:

| Configuration | Capacitance |
|---------------|-------------|
| Series | 1/C_total = 1/C1 + 1/C2 |
| Parallel | C_total = C1 + C2 |

## Inductors:

| Configuration | Inductance |
|---------------|------------|
| Series | L_total = L1 + L2 |
| Parallel | 1/L_total = 1/L1 + 1/L2 |

slides.title: Kirchhoff's Laws
slides.content:
# Kirchhoff's Laws

## Kirchhoff's Current Law (KCL):
**At any node, sum of currents entering = sum leaving**

```
Sum(I_in) = Sum(I_out)
```

## Kirchhoff's Voltage Law (KVL):
**Around any closed loop, sum of voltages = 0**

```
Sum(V) = 0
```

## Analysis Methods:
- Node voltage method
- Mesh current method
- Superposition
- Thevenin/Norton equivalents

slides.title: AC Circuits
slides.content:
# AC Circuits

## AC vs DC:
- DC: Constant voltage/current
- AC: Sinusoidal, varies with time

## AC Parameters:
```
v(t) = V_m x sin(omega x t + phi)
```
- V_m = peak voltage
- omega = 2 x pi x f (angular frequency)
- f = frequency (Hz)
- phi = phase angle

## RMS Values:
```
V_rms = V_m / sqrt(2) = 0.707 x V_m
```

## Power:
- Real power (W): P = V x I x cos(phi)
- Reactive power (VAR): Q = V x I x sin(phi)
- Apparent power (VA): S = V x I

slides.title: Impedance
slides.content:
# Impedance

## Definition:
Total opposition to AC current flow.

```
Z = R + jX
```

## Component Impedances:

| Component | Impedance |
|-----------|----------|
| Resistor | Z = R |
| Capacitor | Z = 1/(j x omega x C) = -j/(omega x C) |
| Inductor | Z = j x omega x L |

## Magnitude:
```
|Z| = sqrt(R^2 + X^2)
```

## Phase Angle:
```
theta = arctan(X/R)
```

slides.title: Semiconductors
slides.content:
# Semiconductors

## Silicon:
- Basis of modern electronics
- Intrinsic vs doped

## Doping:
- n-type: Extra electrons (phosphorus)
- p-type: Extra holes (boron)

## PN Junction:
- Diode formed
- Forward bias: Conducts
- Reverse bias: Blocks

## Key Devices:

| Device | Function |
|--------|----------|
| Diode | One-way conductor |
| LED | Light emitter |
| BJT | Current amplifier |
| MOSFET | Voltage-controlled switch |
| Op-amp | Signal processing |

slides.title: Digital Electronics
slides.content:
# Digital Electronics

## Binary System:
- 0 and 1 only
- High voltage = 1, Low = 0

## Logic Gates:

| Gate | Function | Output |
|------|----------|--------|
| AND | A AND B | 1 only if both 1 |
| OR | A OR B | 1 if either 1 |
| NOT | NOT A | Inverts |
| NAND | NOT (A AND B) | Universal gate |
| XOR | A XOR B | 1 if exactly one 1 |

## Sequential Logic:
- Flip-flops (memory)
- Registers
- Counters

## Microcontrollers:
- Programmable
- Arduino, PIC, ARM

slides.title: Power Generation
slides.content:
# Power Generation

## Generation Types:

| Type | Principle |
|------|----------|
| Thermal | Steam turbine (coal, gas, nuclear) |
| Hydro | Water turbine |
| Wind | Wind turbine |
| Solar PV | Photovoltaic effect |
| Geothermal | Earth's heat |

## Generator:
- Faraday's law
- Rotating magnetic field
- Produces AC

## Efficiency:
- Thermal: 35-45%
- Hydro: 80-90%
- Wind: 30-45%
- Solar: 15-22%

slides.title: Power Transmission
slides.content:
# Power Transmission

## Why High Voltage:
- Power loss = I^2 x R
- Higher V = Lower I for same power
- Less loss over distance

## Transmission Voltages:
- Generation: ~20 kV
- Transmission: 110-765 kV
- Distribution: 4-35 kV
- Consumer: 120/240 V

## Transformers:
```
V1/V2 = N1/N2
```
- Step-up for transmission
- Step-down for distribution

## Grid:
- Interconnected network
- Load balancing
- Reliability

slides.title: Electrical Safety
slides.content:
# Electrical Safety

## Hazards:
- Electric shock
- Burns
- Fire
- Arc flash

## Current Effects:

| Current (mA) | Effect |
|--------------|--------|
| 1 | Perception |
| 10-20 | Muscle freeze |
| 100+ | Ventricular fibrillation |

## Protection:
- Grounding
- Circuit breakers
- Fuses
- GFCI/RCD
- Insulation

## Safe Practices:
- Lock-out/tag-out
- Test before touch
- Personal protective equipment

slides.title: Control Systems
slides.content:
# Control Systems

## Open Loop:
- No feedback
- Output not measured
- Example: Toaster

## Closed Loop:
- Feedback present
- Error = Setpoint - Output
- Controller adjusts

## PID Control:
```
u(t) = Kp*e + Ki*int(e) + Kd*de/dt
```
- P = Proportional
- I = Integral
- D = Derivative

## Applications:
- Temperature control
- Motor speed control
- Position control

slides.title: Summary
slides.content:
# Electrical Engineering Summary

## Circuits:
- Ohm's Law: V = IR
- Power: P = VI
- Kirchhoff's laws (KCL, KVL)

## Electronics:
- Semiconductors (diodes, transistors)
- Digital logic gates
- Analog signals

## Power Systems:
- Generation, transmission, distribution
- High voltage for efficiency
- Safety: Grounding, breakers

## Applications:
- Control systems
- Communications
- Renewable energy

> **Congratulations!** You've completed Electrical Engineering!
